qas.question: How long ago did the first vertebrate organisms appear?
During which scientific period did vertebrates appear?
Sharks appeared at about how many Mya?
The foremost part of the brain in mammals is known as what?
At how many mya did mammals first appear in time?

context: The first vertebrates appeared <a0_0>over 500 million years ago<a0_0/> (Mya), during the <a1_0>Cambrian period<a1_0/>, and may have resembled the modern hagfish in form. Sharks appeared about <a2_0>450 Mya<a2_0/>, amphibians about 400 Mya, reptiles about 350 Mya, and mammals about <a4_0>200 Mya<a4_0/>. Each species has an equally long evolutionary history, but the brains of modern hagfishes, lampreys, sharks, amphibians, reptiles, and mammals show a gradient of size and complexity that roughly follows the evolutionary sequence. All of these brains contain the same set of basic anatomical components, but many are rudimentary in the hagfish, whereas in mammals the foremost part <a3_0>(the telencephalon<a3_0/>) is greatly elaborated and expanded.
